Docs.summary: Represents a control that renders text that can be changed by the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Controls, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> and those that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>, provide a text property that can be changed by a page user. When the text property is changed, an event is raised to notify handlers that the property has changed. Classes that implement <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl> must define the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl.TextChanged> event.
Although the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl> interface contains only the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl.TextChanged> event, it inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl> interface, which defines a <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property. To implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl> interface, a control must define the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl.TextChanged> event that occurs when the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property changes between posts to the server.
<xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl> is implemented by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>. In those classes, the event is raised through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnTextChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox.OnTextChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods. A class that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl> interface could define a similar method for raising the event.

## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl.TextChanged> event occurs when the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property changes between posts to the server. An implementation of this event can be found in either the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> control.
